physics_1903_6.name: Marie Curie
physics_1903_6.work_location: École de physique et chimie industrielles, Paris, France
physics_1903_6.source: Worked at École de physique et chimie industrielles and University of Paris

physics_1999_159.name: Martinus J.G. Veltman
physics_1999_159.source: Professor at Utrecht 1966-1981, where he and 't Hooft did their Nobel work

physics_2017_941.name: Rainer Weiss
physics_2017_941.source: Professor at MIT, did LIGO work there

physics_2017_942.name: Barry C. Barish
physics_2017_942.source: Principal investigator and director of LIGO at Caltech

physics_2017_943.name: Kip S. Thorne
physics_2017_943.source: Feynman Professor at Caltech, did LIGO work there

chemistry_1993_278.name: Kary B. Mullis
chemistry_1993_278.source: Invented PCR at Cetus Corp in 1983

chemistry_2001_741.name: William Knowles
chemistry_2001_741.work_location: Monsanto Company, St. Louis, MO, USA
chemistry_2001_741.source: Developed enantioselective hydrogenation at Monsanto in 1968

medicine_2005_790.name: J. Robin Warren
medicine_2005_790.source: Pathologist at Royal Perth Hospital where he discovered H. pylori

literature_1901_569.name: Sully Prudhomme
literature_1901_569.source: French poet who lived and worked in Paris

literature_1902_571.name: Theodor Mommsen
literature_1902_571.source: Professor at University of Berlin from 1861-1887, wrote History of Rome

literature_1903_572.name: Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson
literature_1903_572.source: Norwegian writer who worked in Bergen, Oslo, and lived intermittently abroad. No single location.

literature_1904_573.name: Frédéric Mistral
literature_1904_573.source: Lived his entire life in Maillane, wrote all his works there

literature_1904_574.name: José Echegaray
literature_1904_574.source: Wrote plays in Madrid, where he spent his career

literature_1905_575.name: Henryk Sienkiewicz
literature_1905_575.source: Studied at University of Warsaw, co-edited Słowo newspaper in Warsaw

literature_1906_576.name: Giosuè Carducci
literature_1906_576.source: Professor at University of Bologna 1860-1904, where he did all his major work

literature_1907_577.name: Rudyard Kipling
literature_1907_577.source: Living at Bateman's in Sussex when he won the Nobel Prize in 1907

literature_1908_578.name: Rudolf Eucken
literature_1908_578.source: Professor at University of Jena 1874-1920, where he did his Nobel Prize-winning philosophical work

literature_1909_579.name: Selma Lagerlöf
literature_1909_579.source: Born and raised at Mårbacka estate in Värmland, bought it back with Nobel Prize money

literature_1910_580.name: Paul Heyse
literature_1910_580.source: Settled in Munich in 1854 and lived there for rest of his life

literature_1911_581.name: Maurice Maeterlinck
literature_1911_581.source: Belgian who moved to Paris in 1896, later lived in Grasse and Saint-Wandrille, France

literature_1912_582.name: Gerhart Hauptmann
literature_1912_582.source: Lived in Berlin (Erkner, Charlottenburg) where he wrote major works, later Agnetendorf, Silesia

literature_1913_583.name: Rabindranath Tagore
literature_1913_583.source: Founded school at Shantiniketan where he settled and created Gitanjali

literature_1915_584.name: Romain Rolland
literature_1915_584.source: Taught at Sorbonne in Paris, later lived in Rome and Switzerland

literature_1916_585.name: Verner von Heidenstam
literature_1916_585.source: Lived in Stockholm during productive years, also spent time at Olshammar

literature_1917_586.name: Karl Gjellerup
literature_1917_586.source: Spent most of his life in Germany, lived near Dresden

literature_1917_587.name: Henrik Pontoppidan
literature_1917_587.source: Journalist in Copenhagen, lived in rural Zealand and Charlottenlund suburb

literature_1919_588.name: Carl Spitteler
literature_1919_588.source: Wrote Olympian Spring in Switzerland in early 1900s

literature_1920_589.name: Knut Hamsun
literature_1920_589.source: Wrote Growth of the Soil at Skogheim farm in Hamarøy 1911-1917

literature_1921_590.name: Anatole France
literature_1921_590.source: Spent literary career in Paris, worked as librarian for French Senate

literature_1922_592.name: Jacinto Benavente
literature_1922_592.source: Born in Madrid, directed Spanish National Theatre, wrote plays set in Madrid

literature_1923_593.name: William Butler Yeats
literature_1923_593.source: Co-founded Abbey Theatre in Dublin, central to Irish Literary Revival

literature_1924_594.name: Władysław Reymont
literature_1924_594.source: Wrote The Peasants partly in France (1901-1908), also Zakopane; spent winters in Warsaw

literature_1925_596.name: George Bernard Shaw
literature_1925_596.source: Moved to London in 1876, wrote all major works there including Saint Joan

literature_1926_597.name: Grazia Deledda
literature_1926_597.source: Lived and wrote in Rome from 1900-1936

literature_1927_600.name: Henri Bergson
literature_1927_600.source: Held chair of philosophy at Collège de France 1900-1921
